message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of private information retrieval (PIR) from replicated databases, which involves information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The presence of Byzantine and colluding databases introduces a fault tolerance aspect, which is related to distributed systems (cs.DS) and database systems (cs.DB). The paper also uses network coding concepts (cs.CC) in the converse proof.
